Extensive Delays Expected
Extensive delays are expected for inbound and outbound trains due to an Amtrak derailment.

2720 stopped near Bensenville
Train 2720 is currently stopped near Bensenville due to waiting for a train ahead to clear the tracks.

Homewood Platform Elevator Out
The Homewood platform elevator is out of service. Alternate accessible stations are Calumet or Flossmoor.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Construction begins April 21 at 103rd Street Washington Heights Station.
Metra forces will begin work Friday, April 21 on a major rehab project at the 103rd Street/Washington Heights Station on the Rock Island Line, for more informaiton click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Milwaukee North/West trains will arrive and originate from Western Ave until further notice - Amtrak Derailment UPDATE

Due to an Amtrak derailment, Milwaukee North and West trains can't enter or depart Chicago Union station. Trains will arrive and originate from Western Ave until further notice. CTA buses are available that will transport passengers from Chicago Union Station to Western Ave and vice versa. The bus departing Chicago Union Station will board on the east side of Canal street. If you need assistance please contact Metra personnel for assistance. Please listen to platform anouncements for delay times and the location of your train. Metra will provide updated information as it becomes available.
